thread.title: Donald Trump Puts Syrian Refugees 'on Notice'
thread.title_full: Donald Trump Puts Syrian Refugees 'on Notice'

title: Donald Trump Puts Syrian Refugees 'on Notice'
text: Privacy Policy | More Newsletters AP Republican presidential candidate, businessman Donald Trump talks during a campaign stop, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015, in Keene, N.H. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump says he’s going to toughen up on Syrian refugees if he wins the upcoming federal election, NBC News reported. "I'm putting people on notice that are coming here from Syria as part of this mass migration, that if I win, they're going back!" he said at a town hall at a town hall on Wednesday in Keene, New Hampshire. Updated Hurricane Joaquin Could Threaten East Coast The comments are a departure from Trump’s previous, softer remarks about the ongoing refugee crisis. In a speech in Rochester, N.H. two weeks ago, Trump said the U.S. can do something about the crisis, but “we have to get other people to help us.” This is Trump’s 14th visit to New Hampshire. Meet the Candidates: Who's Running in 2016
